User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user in the AccessFlow system.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

googleId.description: Google ID of the user, obtained from Google OAuth2 authentication.

Role.title: Role
Role.description: Represents a user role within the system (e.g., User, TechLead, Admin).

id.description: Unique identifier for the role entity.

permissions.description: List of permissions associated with the role.

Department.title: Department
Department.description: Represents a department within the organization.

id.description: Unique identifier for the department entity.

AccessRequest.title: AccessRequest
AccessRequest.description: Represents an access request submitted by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the access request entity.

requestType.description: Type of the access request (system, data, other).

status.description: Status of the access request (pending, approved, rejected).

approvalDate.description: Date when the access request was approved/rejected.

approverId.description: Reference to User who approved/rejected the request. (Relationship: User 1:N AccessRequest (Approver))

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is designed to support secure Google OAuth2 authentication and role-based access control for the AccessFlow application. The structure prioritizes authorization independence by denormalizing role and department information into the user documents, eliminating the need for `get()` calls in security rules. This allows for atomic operations and simplifies debugging. The structure also supports the required QAPs through segregation (separating roles and departments into distinct collections) and path-based ownership for user-owned data like AccessRequests. This design ensures secure list operations and maintains data integrity.
